To reduce sample attrition between baseline and endline, we conducted two tracking surveys to verify respondentsÃÂ¢Ãâ¬Ãâ¢ contact information in January to March 2015 (98.5% tracking rate) and February to June 2016 (93.8% tracking rate). A.2 Gender attitudes index The gender attitudes outcome variable is constructed by aggregating responses to a wideranging set of individual questions into indices (both an endline index and a baseline index). For questions that used a 5-point Likert scale, the response was first converted to a binary variable coded as 1 if the respondent answered ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÅStrongly AgreeÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÂ or ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÅAgreeÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÂ with a gender-progressive statement (or ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÅStrongly DisagreeÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÂ or ÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÅDisagreeÃÂ¢Ãâ¬ÃÂ with a gender-regressive statement), and 0 otherwise.
